title: Three-Ingredient Baked Chicken Breasts Recipe
description: This easy chicken breast recipe made with few ingredients uses butter and salt to flavor baked chicken for an easy main course for weeknight dinner.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Meat and Poultry Chicken Chicken Breast Three-Ingredient Baked Chicken Breasts 4.4 (435) 347 Reviews 41 Photos An easy chicken breast recipe made with few ingredients. I use this as a basic baked chicken recipe when another recipe calls for cooked chicken. It works great for everything and is super customizable. Sometimes I use garlic salt or other seasonings, depending on what I'm using it for. Submitted by Jennifer Jones Updated on May 21, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 41 41 41 41 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ¼ cup butter, melted 1 teaspoon salt 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly butter a baking dish. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir together melted butter and salt in a bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Arrange chicken in the prepared baking dish. Brush butter mixture onto chicken until thoroughly coated, pouring any extra over chicken. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, 30 to 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 4,519 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 227 Calories 14g Fat 24g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 227 % Daily Value * Total Fat 14g 18% Saturated Fat 8g 41% Cholesterol 95mg 32% Sodium 719mg 31% Protein 24g 47% Calcium 15mg 1% Iron 1mg 4% Potassium 198mg 4% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Three-Ingredient Baked Chicken Breasts 01 of 41 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 41 Photo by  Marilyn 09/18/2023 For dinner this evening I prepared this 3 Ingredient Chicken. I followed the recipe, though I added onion powder, garlic & lemon pepper into the melted butter.I like chicken breasts that have some color, the last 10-15 minutes of cooking time, I changed my oven to broil 550 degrees.This chicken was moist, tender & delicious! From now on when needing cooked chicken for enchiladas, tacos, chicken salad, etc., I’ll cook chicken this way. 03 of 41 Photo by  Madelyn Pestle 04/22/2021 04 of 41 Photo by  alii b 08/26/2020 05 of 41 Photo by  trina frederick 08/11/2020 Love it!! Butter my breasts anytime! The juices from the chicken meld perfect with the butter making a tasty sauce or base for gravy. I used some seasonings for chicken in addition to the salt. Lazy girl chicken!! 06 of 41 Photo by  Lori 08/04/2020 07 of 41 Photo by  StrongWhisk5479 06/28/2020 08 of 41 Photo by  Laurie Rogers 06/20/2019 09 of 41 Photo by  Amanda Bloom Felchlin 04/15/2019 The only thing I added was a chopped clove of garlic and made sure to flip it halfway... it was DELICIOUS. Easily the easiest and tastiest chicken breast I’ve ever made. Can’t wait to play with this recipe! 10 of 41 Photo by  michiganmom 12/03/2018 Very nice variation on grilled or sautéed chicken. Because many reviews said the chicken was pale I brushed it with “kitchen bouquet” browning sauce after pouring the butter over it. A few grinds of black pepper and into the oven for 45 min. I checked the temp at 40 min and it was 158, I should have pulled it then to allow for carry over cooking. 5 min later it wasn’t dry but was 168 degrees. Nicely browned. Picky grandson declared it delicious! Will make again. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Kicky Stuffed Chicken 1 Rating Feta Chicken 741 Ratings Lemon Garlic Chicken Breasts 82 Ratings Simply Parmesan Chicken 470 Ratings Instant Pot Shredded Chicken 8 Ratings Healthy Instant Pot® Chicken Breasts 2 Ratings Breaded Parmesan Ranch Chicken 346 Ratings Zippy Orange Rosemary Chicken 8 Ratings Spicy Doritos® Chicken 13 Ratings Baked Pesto Chicken Tenders 18 Ratings Barbeque Bacon Chicken Bake 237 Ratings BBQ Chicken Pouches 5 Ratings Salsa Chicken 4,750 Ratings Amy's Amazing Baked Chicken Breasts 2 Ratings Gluten-Free Shake and Bake Almond Chicken 66 Ratings Tasty Bake Chicken 55 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center and juices run clear, 30 to 45 minutes.
